meanings.definition: To utter a loud cry or call.
meanings.sent1: She shouted for help when she saw the spider.
meanings.sent2: The coach shouted instructions to the players during the game.
meanings.sent3: The parrot shouted back at the noisy children in the park.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm shouted its arrival with booming thunder.
meanings.sent5: The teacher shouted the answer to the question across the classroom.

meanings.sent1: He shouted his disagreement with the decision at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The angry customer shouted at the manager in the store.
meanings.sent3: The toddler shouted with joy when she saw the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent4: The wind shouted through the trees on the stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The politician shouted his promises to the crowd during the rally.
